critique: This document designates the International Fund for Agricultural Development as a public international organization, entitling it to certain privileges, exemptions, and immunities under the International Organizations Immunities Act. This seems to be an administrative action to facilitate US participation in the organization. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power expansion, federalism implications, national security vs. civil liberties concerns, economic regulation, or social inclusion aspects. Therefore, most scores should be neutral.
